headline: Basic Corn Muffins
description: This super-quick corn muffin recipe can easily be dressed up by adding shredded cheese, jalapenos, blueberries, or whatever add-ins you want to try!

video.name: How to Make Basic Corn Muffins

name: Basic Corn Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease muffin pan or line with paper muffin liners.
In a large bowl, mix together corn meal, flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
Add egg, oil and milk; stir gently to combine.
Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean.

review.reviewBody: I love this recipe...only thing I added 1/2 tsp vanilla and cinnamon and I used 1 cup evaporated milk mized with 1/2 cup water as the evaporated milk is thicker and it came out beautifully

Might just be the best, basic cornmeal muffin I’ve tried! My one error which actually seems to have worked out very well, was not to have enough milk. I substituted 1/3 cup of plain yogurt along with 2/3 cup of milk. Worked out really well! Now I wonder how dried cherries would work here. Thanks for this recipe!

Wonderful, easy recipe. Did not have milk, so used 4 level tablespoons powdered buttermilk and a cup of water. I did replace sugar 1:1 with erythritol to cut down on sugar intake. I also used avocado oil in place of canola because that's what I have on hand. Muffins baked for 15 minutes in 12 silicone muffin cups. They were excellent with just a pat of butter. Will surely make these again!
I added one cup of frozen blueberries and what a treat that is! Also used 1/4 cup of batter per muffin and got a dozen muffins from my muffin pan. I also used whole milk and they were nice and moist.

I substituted 2/3 cup plain Greek yogurt and 1/2 cup milk for the 1 cup milk called for in the recipe, because of the previous comments about the muffins baking up dry. The resulting muffins were moist and sufficiently sweet to my taste. Thus adjusted, the recipe made 14 muffins. In my next batch, I plan to stir in a cup of currants for a little additional sweetness.
It was quick and easy. I was wondering what to eat for breakfast since I had ran out of bread at the time. I added some cubed cherries and brown sugar glaze on the top.
Easy, quick and good!
Dry and grainy, needs about twice as much salt and baking powder. Look for other recipes for the right proportions
It was very bland. I like a little more sweetness in my muffins
This is my go to recipe.. quick easy and great.

Excellent recipe. Used farofa instead of cornmeal, added tiny jalapeno pieces and grated cheese for interest. Baked for 10m, broil for 2 mins, flipped and baked for another 7m as things take longer in my oven.

Great classic recipe The people who found them dry either baked them too long or had the oven too low Too low prevents a good fast rise Also be careful if you use Pyrex pans Lower the oven 10 degrees. I the toothpick will never come out clean because corn meal is grainy Don’t let it fool you I use paper liners and make 6 large. People love a nice big breakfast muffin with Finally once you get the recipe right try orange or lemon zest and maybe a turn or two of fresh ground black pepper in the batter Good luck

I made these according to the recipe, except I used 1/2 & 1/2 instead of milk, because i had no milk. I found them slightly dry, and a bit bland, I think I will follow other's suggestion, and add corn meal, and reduce flour.
This is m gonto recipe when I need to make something fast for my grandsons and I used to make it when my own children were growing it is a huge hit with them
Easy to make, delicious, and pretty corn muffins. Next time I will experiment by adding peppers, green onions, and/or cheese.
Tried this recipe for the first time and it's my new fav.
It was very easy to make and good

I have used many corn muffin recipes but this one is perfect. I didn't change anything. These are just the right amount of sweetness, cakiness, crumbly goodness. Nice browned on the bottom made them perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy inside. Used generic yellow corn meal too.
Not the fluffiest muffins, but certainly not hockey pucks like some reviews make them seem. I subbed buttermilk and also added a cup of sugared blueberries. Very good!
These were horrible. Bland and boring!

So tasty and tender! I used a 1/4 cup sugar and unsweetened vanilla almond milk instead of milk. They taste really good with that bit of vanilla sweetness. If I’m making them savoury with cheese or something, I use regular milk.
Easy and delicious.

They’re alright I guess. Appearance-wise, I wish they had been more yellow and less whitish. Taste-wise, they were a little lacking in flavor. They’re not bad, but they’re not something I’d show off either. Maybe I’ll find a different recipe that suits my taste better, and for anyone reading this- you will probably like this recipe if you’re not super into sweet muffins.
added jalapenos and cheddar and subbed in oat milk for liquid.
Added a bit of Greek youghurt and it turned out perfect!
Loved this! Added 2 Tbsp of honey to the milk. Should have cut the sugar. Was very sweet. Did not stick to my silicone muffin pan. Would make again!

I make these all the time but vegan. To make butter milk use a cup vegan milk alternative and a tablespoon of ACV and let it sit till curls. (Like a few minutes) and replace the egg with unsweetened apple sauce

Hubby loved them. I didn't have a cornbread mix, so tried this, and used some of the changes in the reviews: more cornmeal/less flour, added sour cream, etc. Very tasty and not too difficult. I skimped on the salt and will go with 1 tsp vs 1/2 tsp next time.

The type of cornmeal you use makes a difference. I see some reviewers commenting rather the muffins were dry. I made 2 batches and used 2 different types of cornmeal...Quaker (a little coarser grind) and Indian Head (closer to flour like texture) The muffins with Indian Head were more moist and cakes. Good muffin.
I ran out of milk so I used water instead. It still turned out well. My son loved them!:)
I liked the muffin recipe, but I did add 1/4 of melted butter also. Did the trick. Tasted great!
Perfect as is! Not too sweet with brilliant texture. using the muffin method, I let the batter rest for 10 mins before panning.

Very good basic recipe. 
I'm glad I watched the video before making this so I knew the batter should be fairly thin. My batter looked like a shaggy bread dough & I quickly figured out the indoor humidity of only 30% was affecting more than just my skin! I added another egg and about 1/3 c of milk. I also substituted melted butter for the oil. I had stoneground "blue" cornmeal which makes a nicely speckled texture.
Easy and tasty
Just made this this morning. It was a simple recipe but came out very dry. Will not be using this recipe again.

This is my go-to corn muffin recipe..we usually have these ingredients on hand, they are moist, easy to throw together. The only thing I change is I cut the sugar in half but they are just as yummy and moist! Love this recipe!
Easy to make and so yummy!
Best corn muffins ever. Made it just as described and the muffins were perfect. Thank you!

I made these, they were great! I added 2 tablespoons of honey which added a nice sweet taste to them. They were quite moist. I baked them for 14 minutes at 400 which was plenty of time to keep them moist. I got 18 good sized muffins from the basic recipe posted.

I made these today and didn't look at the reviews. Boy, am I sorry!
They are very dry and crumbly. I didn't expect them to be the texture of a quick bread but I did think they would be similar to cornbread in texture.
I think when I make them again I will add more flour and milk. Maybe use a the same amount of unsweetened applesauce as oil. That should moisten them nicely.
I added a little more sugar to the mixture and I drizzled honey on the top. Other than that, it’s was good and easy to make! I made 12 but my kids ate 4 of them before I was able to take a photo.
I’ve made these several times and they turned out perfect each time. They are great served with jambalaya, Mexican recipes, chili etc.
Followed the suggestions of reviewers and cut down on the sugar and added more cornmeal. Delicious.
My family enjoyed them. I'm used to ones that are monster and sweeter, more like Johnny cake. Very, very dry the next day.
excellent
It added town sugar to make it sweet it is a good recipe
It’s fun to adjust recipes and have add-ins, but this one needs no changes.

Ok I chose this recipe because it was so highly rated by so many people. I followed the recipe meticulously as it was written. These were dry and totally void of flavor. They were literally the worst corn muffins I ever ate. But they looked nice.
Very easy. And delicious!

I loved these. I'm bringing them to my daughters for dinner.
This recipe made 12 muffins . I substituted coconut milk for cow's milk and apple sauce instead of oil. Then I added 1 cup of canned corn to the batter. This was my first time ever making corn bread muffins and I have to say they were moist and delicious. I'll have to put them away or I will be tempted to eat the entire batch 
Defiantly a delicious addition to any meal.
Delicious with butter and jam.
Been making this recipe for years. Sometimes add some honey in top, sometimes some grated orange. Very versatile! Love this tasty recipe.

Yummy muffins, especially paired with spicy soup! I used the main recipe and tweeted according to Rachel Anne’s comments #15 on the list.
I did put in 1/2 cup frozen corn kernels thawed and squeezed the moisture out and 1/2 cup cheddar cheese.

These are sweet muffins! I can't understand the reviews saying they're not sweet enough. As I understand cornbread muffins are simply cornbread baked in a muffin shape, and I planned to eat them with soup. They were too sweet to eat with a savoury dish, however, so we ate them after the soup with butter and jam. Very nice, but not what I was expecting.
Excellent! Added honey in the mix, as well as on top as a glaze! will definitely make it again!
I made the recipe as is. I thought it was great. I used a stone ground corn meal and my daughter thought the texture was a little rough. Maybe I’ll try another cornmeal next time.
I addd some vanilla extract for additional flavor.
Very simple recipe, great with butter or jam. best eaten warm..not many leftovers..

Excellent recipe and agree its easily altered for personal taste! Only have grits? --clean out your coffee grinder, (dry only--then grind 1/4 cup of your grits to clear out coffee leftovers) and grind your grits for about 15 - 30 seconds, to make the muffins less gritty, and hold together more. I personally liked a little salt-1/4 teaspoon did it for me and mixed it onto the dry blend. Had bacon fat around, so melted 2 TBS of that and made up the remaining with oil for the full 1/4 cup. Buttermilk helped hold them together better and keep them moist. Not much more time to make this over the boxed mix--which yes often times gets infested with moths (or sometimes comes that way). Keep your grits/mix int he fridge to prevent infestation. Moths love whole grain flours and corn meal...
Delicious! My family of 5 ate them up quickly. Had to make another batch the next day! My new "go to" recipe!

Delicious! I made this for Easter to go with my turkey on the side. It was perfect! Not too sweet. I was able to whip it up and pop it in the oven while the turkey was resting and everyone loved it. The only thing is that it got stuck to the paper liners. Should I have sprayed the liners first? I've never had to do that before if I use paper liners for muffins, etc.

I made this as written a couple of times already, and they were good! But this morning I was making bacon and felt inspired- so today I subbed bacon grease for the canola oil. Also, because bacon is super salty, I omitted the salt called for. Even the smell of them has become several times more enchanting! It did make the initial batter a bit thicker because the fridge cold milk and egg sort of set the fat a little bit. But they came out beautiful and the flavor is really nuanced and lovely. As written this recipe is amazing! But if you want to treat yourself, use bacon fat! (I would imagine schmaltz would also be as good or better)

These came out great! My new go-to homemade cornmuffin recipe! Okay, I did adjust the cormeal/flour ration: I reduced the flour amount by 1/4 cup, and added an additional 1/4 of cornmeal. Oh so good! Thank you!
I used monk fruit sweetener instead of sugar and added a cup of fresh blueberries. They were delicious.
I followed another reviewer's tip and added an extra 1/4 cup of cornmeal. Also baked at 375 instead of 400 for about 17 minutes and of course added a cup of frozen wild blueberries! Yum!

This is a fantastic recipe. I made it following the recipe exactly. I was concerned that the batter was too thin, but they baked up perfectly with lovely high domes. The muffins were moist with just a slight hint of sweetness. The muffins were light and not at all heavy. I baked them for 15 minutes, which was the perfect amount of time. I will definitely make these again.
Super easy and simple! I only had peanut oil, and it worked perfectly.
Great recipe. I make these all the time. Best cornbread muffins, not overloaded with fat like some recipes. Can back down a bit on the sugar if you like for more ‘corn’ flavor.
I substituted evaporated milk and mixed butter with corn oil. I also added honey with a little less sugar
willmake again
I made these exactly as the recipe says and they were soooo bland. Very sad as I’m taking them to a party tonight and know they will disappoint people :(
Definitely make it again. You can even lower the sugar a bit.
These were great! Soft inside, crunchy outside. The only thing i would change was adding more cornmeal. And double the recipe cause i came out with 8 on this one. I will make this again.

I made exactly as the recipe called for, and very happy with the results.
Rather than muffins, did this as a corn bread baked in a glass baking dish.
This will be a go-to recipe!
Exactly as the recipe said. They are delicious. Just the right amount of sweet, and crunchy

If you’re looking for a sweet and moist corn muffin, then this isn’t the recipe for you. I made it as stated but added a tablespoon of honey. They were just slightly on the dry side and a little bland. Nothing special. If you don’t like sweet muffins like, say, Famous Dave’s then these are decent. Personally, I need more flavor.

I was looking for a basic corn bread recipe and decided to try this one. I had to substitute a few ingredients since I didn’t have everything listed in the recipe. I exchanged gluten-free flour for the all-purpose, used Sweve (sugar substitute) in place of the white sugar, coconut for the oil and coconut milk. The batter was very thick and I worried how they would turn out once cooked. I cooked the muffins for 15 minutes and they came out perfect. They had a nice moist cake texture in the middle, with a crisp top, but not too dry. A definite keeper!
Super easy and very tasty. Plus lower calorie than other recipes.

I made this before & hubby devoured them. Thus thine I added a half cup whole kernel corn, a quarter cup canola oil, quarter cup of finely shredded cheese to the mix and followed baking directions. Delicious!!
Love it!!!!
I made this recipe since I didn’t have the Jiffy box mix on hand for my chili. These turned out delicious, just as good as the box mix.
So yummy 15 minutes was to Much time

I followed the advice of a previous reviewer and used stone ground cornmeal and reduced the sugar just slightly by maybe a tablespoon or two. I added an extra egg and 1 cup of Tex Mex shredded cheese. My picky 6 yr old ate one while still warm and came back asking for seconds. I love these muffins, delicate flavour, delicious and perfect to add to a brunch.

Based on reviews I tweaked my recipe a bit - used 1.25 cups of corn meal and 3/4 cup of flour, 2 eggs, 1/2 tsp of vanilla, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1 tap baking soda and 1 tap baking powder. I omitted the salt and replaced the cup of milk with 1/2 cup orange juice and 1/2 cup water. I also added in frozen blueberries. The muffins were a bit dry but not terribly so. Next time I would add even more blueberries and maybe some chocolate chips.
I used P.A.N. corn flour. Added 1 12 jalapeño diced and a speck of cayenne. Super!
I will never use the box mixes again
I used gluten-free all purpose flour. I had to add more milk than called for in the recipe, but they turned out moist and delicious. You can't tell they're gluten-free!
Excellent base, I added, 1/2 diced jalapeño pepper and 1/2 cup cheddar cheese. So yummy!

Used this as a base recipe for some corn muffins I made to get rid of veggies I had lying around that needed to be used. The muffins themselves turned out beautifully fluffy inside with a nice crisp outside. For my version, I added a few small poblano peppers and corn cut off the cob that I'd sauteed in butter with paprika and a wild amount of black pepper, along with some locally made asiago-like cheese. They came out wonderfully and I have this base recipe to thank!
no changes needed
no changes needed
Super good
I added frozen corn thrawd and green onions. They were yummy
Just made these exactly as per Recipe & they turned out perfectly...next time I will try some of the suggestions. 15 min. baking time & just sprayed the muffin cups.
I will never buy packaged mix again. Nice and moist and super easy!

I like my corn muffins sweet and moist and this recipe was neither, it needs more sugar and more oil or shortening...definitely fell short from what I was looking for, but if you like your corn muffins only slightly sweet and don't mind them being dry sort of like cracker barrel's then this recipe if for you. It's really personal taste when it comes to these.
Soft and slightly sweet.

These came out great! Made as is, it's just the right amount of sweetness (and I don't like too sweet) with a good, dense cake-like texture, how you'd expect a corn muffin to be. I used Jillian's suggestion of 1 1/4 cups cornmeal and 3/4 cup flour. For the milk, I used the dry buttermilk blend that you add water to. I made these into six jumbo muffins that were ready at about 16 min. I couldn't resist having one (half!) right out of the oven....delicious with a little butter spread. Will be good for breakfast. I would try adding shredded cheese or pickled jalapenos another time, but these are great as they are! Easy recipe, too. Thanks!
I make theses and freeze half of them. They are so delicious.
